name: Tooltip

jtbd.functional: Provide supplementary information about an element on hover or focus. Non-essential context that helps but isn't required for the primary task.
jtbd.affordance: Small dark label that appears above the trigger element. Users recognize this as supplementary info — it appears on demand and disappears when attention moves away.
jtbd.emotional: Reduces uncertainty. When users aren't sure what an icon or abbreviated label means, the tooltip provides reassurance without cluttering the interface.

anatomy.wrapper: .t-tooltip-wrapper — Relative-positioned container around the trigger element
anatomy.tooltip: .t-tooltip — Absolutely positioned label with arrow, appears on hover/focus
anatomy.arrow: .t-tooltip::after — CSS triangle pointing toward the trigger element

position.top: Default — tooltip appears above the trigger (bottom: calc(100% + var(--t-space-2)))

accessibility.ariaDescribedby: Trigger element should reference tooltip via aria-describedby
accessibility.keyboard: Tooltip must appear on focus (not just hover) for keyboard users
accessibility.screenReader: Tooltip content announced via aria-describedby relationship
accessibility.escapeKey: Pressing Escape should dismiss the tooltip (requires JS)
accessibility.timing: Tooltip should not appear instantly — slight delay prevents accidental triggers

knownIssues: Only top position implemented — no bottom, left, right variants
No collision detection (tooltip may overflow viewport)
Arrow border color uses hardcoded reference to --t-bg-inverse
No delay on show/hide — appears instantly on hover
futureConsiderations: Position variants: bottom, left, right with auto-flip
